p: Current guidelines recommend that remdesivir (five-day course) be prioritized for hospitalized SARS-CoV-2 patients who are on supplemental oxygen but do not require high-flow oxygen, noninvasive ventilation, mechanical ventilation, or extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) [ 24]. Remdesivir is a broad-spectrum antiviral medication that works by targeting viral RNA polymerase and terminating viral transcription. This medication was first trialed back in January on a SARS-CoV-2 patient, who later was noted to recover rather remarkably [ 7]. Early studies showed high in vitro potency effects, favorable side effect profiles, and improvements in oxygen support among patients receiving compassionate remdesivir [ 38- 39]. However, several large clinical trials were launched by both Gilead (SIMPLE trials) and the NIH (ACTT trial) to evaluate the true efficacy of this medication [ 40- 42].
